title: Changing the theme/language caused a previously closed webpage to be reopened constantly - single event issue

labels.name: Android 11/12 (FADP-8)
labels.description: Bring Focus up to date with changed functionality in Android

body:
## Steps to reproduce
Note that the following actions were performed before the issue occurred, but it could not be reproduced again:
1. Visit edition.cnn.com.
2. Tap on the shield icon > From the ETP panel, disable all the toggles from the "Trackers and Scripts to block".
3. Perform all the steps from the last comment from issue https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/focus-android/issues/5245 : 
Disabled the ETP.
Add the page to the device's homescreen.
Cleared the history.
Opened the shortcut from the device's homescreen - the ETP is ON/enabled, even if the page is still listed in the Exceptions.
4. While the webpage opened from the home screen shortcut in step 3 is loading, quickly access the Settings > General Menu.
5. Repeatedly change the theme and the language.
6. Repeat steps 4-5 until the issue can be observed.

### Expected behavior
The application should behave properly. Quickly accessing the Settings menu and tapping on various options should not interfere with/affect the web page.

### Actual behavior
Issue https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/focus-android/issues/5245 was reproduced, and while the page was loading, the user was able to interfere with it while quickly changing the theme/language from Settings > General Menu.
Once a theme/language was selected, the focus was moved on the web page from step 3.
After clearing the browsing history and selecting another theme/language option, the same page was re-opened again, each time.

This was a single time event, could not be reproduced using the same device or other devices.
### Device information

* Android device: Google Pixel 6 (Android 12).
* Focus version: Beta 97.0.0-beta.1.
